# google\_compute\_ssl\_certificate

Get info about a Google Compute SSL Certificate from its name.

## Example Usage

```python
import constructs as constructs
import cdktf as cdktf
# Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
# See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.
import ...gen.providers.google as google
class MyConvertedCode(cdktf.TerraformStack):
    def __init__(self, scope, name):
        super().__init__(scope, name)
        data_google_compute_ssl_certificate_my_cert =
        google.data_google_compute_ssl_certificate.DataGoogleComputeSslCertificate(self, "my_cert",
            name="my-cert"
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "certificate",
            value=data_google_compute_ssl_certificate_my_cert.certificate
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "certificate_id",
            value=data_google_compute_ssl_certificate_my_cert.certificate_id
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "self_link",
            value=data_google_compute_ssl_certificate_my_cert.self_link
        )
```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `name` (Required) - The name of the certificate.

- - -

* `project` - (Optional) The project in which the resource belongs. If it
    is not provided, the provider project is used.

## Attributes Reference

See [google_compute_ssl_certificate](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/compute_ssl_certificate) resource for details of the available attributes.
